    <script>
        $('#tell-me-more').click(function () {
            var clickSource = $("body").attr("class") + '-mini';
            if ($("body").hasClass("questions-page")) {
                clickSource = 'questionpagemini';
            }
            if ($("body").hasClass("home-page")) {
                clickSource = 'homepagemini';
            }

            StackExchange.using("gps", function () {
                StackExchange.gps.track("aboutpage.click", { aboutclick_location: clickSource } , true);
            });
        });
        $('#herobox-mini #close').click(function () {
            StackExchange.using("gps", function () {
                StackExchange.gps.track("hero.action", { hero_action_type: "close" }, true);
            });
            $.cookie("hero", "none", { path: "/" });
            var $hero = $("#herobox-mini");
            $hero.slideUp('fast', function () { $hero.remove(); });
            return false;
        });
    </script>

			<!--googleon: all-->
			<div id="question-header">
			<h1 itemprop="name"><a href="/questions/19140672/how-to-keep-divs-from-overlapping" class="question-hyperlink">How to keep Divs from overlapping</a></h1>
		</div>
			<div id="mainbar">

			

<div class="question" data-questionid="19140672"  id="question">
    
            <div class="everyonelovesstackoverflow" id="careers1">
        </div>


    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="19140672">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">1</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful">down vote</a>
    
    <a class="star-off" href="#" title="This is a favorite question (click again to undo)">favorite</a>
    <div class="favoritecount"><b></b></div>   

</div>

            </td>
            
<td class="postcell">
<div>
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="description">

        <p>I want container 2 to always be located below container 1 but outside of the "background" div.  I can do this with a wide screen but when the screen narrows. container2 floats on top of container1. How do I keep container2 below?</p>

<p>css container1 and container2 both have the css values from twitter's bootstrap "container" class.  I just added the 1 and 2 to help explain what I needed.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;div class="Background"&gt;
   &lt;div class="container1"&gt;
      &lt;div class="row "&gt;
         &lt;h1&gt;&lt;/h1&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;div class="row "&gt;
         &lt;div&gt;
         &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;      
   &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class="container2"&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>CSS</p>

<pre><code>.Background{
 height: 250px;
 color: #cccccc;
 }
.container {
 padding-right: 15px;
 padding-left: 15px;
 margin-right: auto;
 margin-left: auto;
 }
</code></pre>

    </div>
    <div class="post-taglist">
        <a href="/questions/tagged/html" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'html'" rel="tag">html</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/css" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'css'" rel="tag">css</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/twitter-bootstrap" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'twitter-bootstrap'" rel="tag">twitter-bootstrap</a> 
    </div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    </td>
    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

    <tr id="comment-28308971" class="comment" data-commentid="28308971">
        <td></td>
        <td class="comment-text"><div><span class="comment-copy">They both have to have <code>display:block</code></span> &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/2680216/joshc" title="4596 reputation" class="comment-user">JoshC</a> <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2013-10-02 15:29:48Z" class="relativetime-clean">19 mins ago</span></span></div></td>

    <tr id="comment-28308999" class="comment" data-commentid="28308999">
        <td></td>
        <td class="comment-text"><div><span class="comment-copy">@JoshC divs have <code>display:block</code> by default.</span> &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/1469087/coop" title="1379 reputation" class="comment-user">Coop</a> <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2013-10-02 15:30:40Z" class="relativetime-clean">19 mins ago</span></span></div></td>
    </tr>
           
    <tr id="comment-28309142" class="comment" data-commentid="28309142">
        <td></td>
        <td class="comment-text"><div><span class="comment-copy">is <code>container&#39;s</code> <code>position:relative</code>?</span> &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/1570553/vishalkin" title="259 reputation" class="comment-user">vishalkin</a> <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2013-10-02 15:34:18Z" class="relativetime-clean">15 mins ago</span></span></div></td>
    </tr>
           
    <tr id="comment-28309158" class="comment" data-commentid="28309158">
        <td></td>
        <td class="comment-text"><div><span class="comment-copy">@Coop Yea, but they may be set to <code>inline</code> or <code>inline-block</code> in the unknown CSS.</span> &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/2680216/joshc" title="4596 reputation" class="comment-user">JoshC</a> <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2013-10-02 15:34:46Z" class="relativetime-clean">14 mins ago</span></span></div></td>

				<div id="answers-header">
					<div class="subheader answers-subheader">
						<h2>
								1 Answer
						</h2>
						<div>

        <a href="/questions/19140672/how-to-keep-divs-from-overlapping?answertab=active#tab-top" title="Answers with the latest activity first">active</a>

<a name="19140814"></a>
<div id="answer-19140814" class="answer" data-answerid="19140814" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="19140814">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">0</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>If you want a different layout on different screens you should use a media query:</p>

<p>You could use absolute positioning on a smaller screen to pull the econd container over the first. You should surround them both in a div with position:relative applied</p>

<pre><code>@media (max-width: 600px) {
  .container2 {
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
  }
</code></pre>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

    <div class="form-item">
        <table>

            <td class="vm">
                <div>
                    <label for="display-name">Name</label>
                    <input id="display-name" name="display-name" type="text" size="30" maxlength="30" value="" tabindex="105">

                    <label for="m-address">Email</label>
                    <input id="m-address" name="m-address" type="text" size="30" maxlength="100" value="" tabindex="106">
                    <span class="edit-field-overlay">required, but not shown</span>
                </div>
            </td>
        </tr>
        </table>
    </div>

            </noscript>
							</div>
           
															<div class="form-submit cbt">
									<input id="submit-button" type="submit" value="Post Your Answer" tabindex="110">
									<a href="#" class="discard-answer dno">discard</a>

<p class="privacy-policy-agreement">
By posting your answer, you agree to the <a href='http://stackexchange.com/legal/privacy-policy' target='_blank'>privacy policy</a> and <a href='http://stackexchange.com/legal/terms-of-service' target='_blank'>terms of service</a>.</p>
<input type="hidden" name="legalLinksShown" value="1" />								</div>
						</form>



						<h2 class="bottom-notice">
Not the answer you&#39;re looking for? 			</div>
		</div>

    (function () {
        var ssl='https:'==document.location.protocol,
            s=document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0],
            ga=document.createElement('script');
        ga.type='text/javascript';
        ga.async=true;
        ga.src=(ssl?'https://ssl':'http://www')+'.google-analytics.com/ga.js';
        s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga,s);
        var sc=document.createElement('script');
        sc.type='text/javascript';
        sc.async=true;
        sc.src=(ssl?'https://secure':'http://edge')+'.quantserve.com/quant.js';

    })();
